channel.title: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?
channel.description:
I'm trying to portforward noobscape v3 and i always get this error: [Error] Address already in use: bind [Error] [Ljava.lang.StackTraceElement;@15575e0 "set as "localhost"
And heres a screenie of the cmd: [IMG]http://i435.photobucket.com/albums/qq79/SegaGameGear/123-1.jpg[/img]
whether its "localhost" or my ip address, i always get that error. Any suggestions?
EDIT: I used server.java to edit localhost.

item.title: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?
item.dc:creator: @Jpark Jpark
item.description:
@Jpark wrote:

BigBadSoft:

Ok I had the same problem, the configuration settings in the folder? click that and you will see server IP and server Port, change that save it, then click run

yeah… Noobscape v3>client>settings… i know that. That never worked.
EDIT: It says: java.net.ConnectionException: connection refused: connect in the cmd.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?

item.title: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?
item.dc:creator: @Jpark Jpark
item.description:
@Jpark wrote:

I figured out the bind problem, and my i know my ip, “192.168…” etc. And there is a tutorial on how to set up a rs private server on my router and it worked… for Divine Pk, but not this… Ive been wanting to use divine pk, but i have no idea to make the website online so people can register their own usernames.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?

item.title: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

If you’re looking to forward your ports, first confirm that your router supports it. There’s nothing worse than trying to diagnose a problem that is out of your control (short of a hardware upgrade). If your router does support forwarding, refer to the documentation on your router for how to forward the desired ports.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?

@Jpark wrote:

martinfin:

I would think java.exe which is about 35,700k … end that process and see what happens.

I fixed it, now only having trouble portforwarding.

item.title: How do i portforward Noobscape v3?
item.dc:creator: @Jpark Jpark
item.description:
@Jpark wrote:

Just change the IP in Server.java to 0.0.0.0 and see how it goes. If you still get an error then something is using that port. Push CTRL + ALT + DEL and make sure all Java processes are closed.

i just get different errors when i change the ip for server.java for example: [Error] [Ljava.lang.StackTraceElement;@15575e0. Also, by java processes, you mean jqc? or something like that?

Read full topic
